references.paper_title: Decomposing complex visual comprehension into atomic visual skills for vision language models
references.reason: This paper is cited as showing that vision-language models have poor atomic visual skills, suggesting that adding visual elements might not aid the geometry problem-solving process.

references.paper_title: Proving and discovering geometry theorems using Wu's method
references.reason: This paper is referenced as one of the two main approaches for automatically solving geometry problems, focusing on algebraic methods.

references.paper_title: Automated production of traditional proofs for constructive geometry theorems
references.reason: This paper details one of the two main approaches for automatically solving geometry problems, focusing on synthetic techniques.

references.paper_title: Machine proofs in geometry: Automated production of readable proofs for geometry theorems
references.reason: This paper is another contribution to the synthetic techniques approach to automatically solving geometry problems.

references.paper_title: Solving olympiad geometry without human demonstrations
references.reason: This paper introduces AlphaGeometry (AG1), the predecessor to AlphaGeometry2, and its limitations are discussed as motivation for the improvements in AlphaGeometry2.
